elements.title: Staghounds (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the last pack of Staghounds (example pictured) in England were those of the North Devon Hunt, which pursued stag in the royal forests of Exmoor until 1825?

elements.title: Medardo Mairena (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that peasant leader Medardo Mairena was the sixth aspiring presidential candidate in the 2021 Nicaraguan general election to be arrested?

elements.title: 181st Street station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that part of the ceiling at the 181st Street station collapsed two days after funding was allocated to repair damage from a similar collapse two years prior?

elements.title: Rainer Trost (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a reviewer wrote that "few tenors on disc can rival the German Rainer Trost" about his 1992 performance as Ferrando in Mozart's Così fan tutte in Paris, with conductor John Eliot Gardiner?

elements.title: stadium districts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that mixed-use stadium districts around major sports venues often include public squares, office space, hotels and residential units?

elements.title: John Mitchell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the freighter John Mitchell was the costliest shipwreck on the Great Lakes in 1911?

elements.title: service of marriage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that instead of fighting in battle, female vassals in the Kingdom of Jerusalem were obliged to render the service of marriage to their lord by marrying one of three candidates proposed to them?

elements.title: Mary Dunn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mary Dunn was reported to have had "many a free ride" in ice hockey, when men "would just lift her up and dump her elsewhere"?
